lines.text: Having to act in a passion play on the mountain... don't you ever feel this is ridiculous?
No. The subject is great, though not very original.
Sure. But this part for an actor is somewhat flimsy, wouldn't you say?
I don't know. The part of Jesus is not what I would call flimsy work.
You did come up with the private conservatory. Wouldn't you like to have a bright career and play the major theatres?
I was away awhile. Seems normal to start at the bottom of the ladder.

[reads court psychologist report]
Better adjusted than most of the judges in this court.
...your average beer drinker has the IQ of a performing dog; 10 points less and he'd be a geranium.

[as Pontius Pilate]
Of what are you accused?

[as Jesus]
You know that.
You belong to a sect? You are another prophet, is that right?
Is that what you say? Or are you repeating what you've heard?
You have spoken of a kingdom that you wish to establish.
A kingdom which is not of this world.
You mean a sort of Elysium? After death? Have you not preached against Caesar, for the overturning of the Roman order?
No.
So... what is it that you teach to your disciples?
to give his life for his friends.
You don't find that a little optimistic as a doctrine? In Rome, you wouldn't have survived a week.
Doing tragedy is dangerous.
Que sera, sera.
Whatever will be, will be.
The future's not ours to see.
Que sera, sera.
Cha cha cha.
